content: give me the course card for math 121

### Course Card: MATH 121 - Linear Algebra

- **Instructor:** John Cain
- **Term:** Spring 2026
- **Mean Hours per Week:** 8.0

**Overall Ratings:**
- **Course Mean:** 4.3

**Description:**
This is a second course in linear algebra, focusing on a more abstract understanding, including the ability to read and write proofs. Key topics cover real and complex vector spaces, linear transformations, and eigenvalues and eigenvectors.

**Requirements:**
- **Anti-Requirement:** This course should not be taken if you've already completed Mathematics 22a, 23a, 25a, or 55a.

**Student Comments:**
- "Very open/exploratory course. You can tell that Dylan REALLY cares about his students. I walked away from the class learning more about my relationship with math and learning. The class could have been better with more structure but it was what I needed for the semester. It is a very easy going course"
- "Take Math 121 :)"
- "If you take this course, be sure to hold yourself accountable. Because of its looser structure, it is easy to allow yourself to fall a bit behind."

**Note:** Even though this course is beyond the scope of your concentration in Akkadian, you've already taken this course, as noted in your student profile. If you’re looking for a related or advanced course, you might want to identify areas in which you want to deepen your knowledge or skills, particularly those that can complement your studies in Akkadian. If you need further advice on interdisciplinary integration of courses or advanced topics in mathematics, feel free to ask!
